org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie

Class BufferedChannel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.BufferedChannelBase
      • org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.BufferedReadChannel
        • org.apache.bookkeeper.bookie.BufferedChannel

  • public class BufferedChannel
extends BufferedReadChannel
    Provides a buffering layer in front of a FileChannel.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(ByteBuffer src)
           throws IOException
        Write all the data in src to the FileChannel. Note that this function can buffer or re-order writes based on the implementation. These writes will be flushed to the disk only when flush() is invoked.
        Parameters:
        src - The source ByteBuffer which contains the data to be written.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a write operation fails.

      • position

        public long position()
        Get the position where the next write operation will begin writing from.
        Returns:

      • getFileChannelPosition

        public long getFileChannelPosition()
        Get the position of the file channel's write pointer.
        Returns:

      • flush

        public void flush(boolean shouldForceWrite)
           throws IOException
        Write any data in the buffer to the file. If sync is set to true, force a sync operation so that data is persisted to the disk.
        Parameters:
        shouldForceWrite -
        Throws:
        IOException - if the write or sync operation fails.

      • forceWrite

        public long forceWrite(boolean forceMetadata)
                throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • read

        public int read(ByteBuffer dest,
                long pos)
         throws IOException
        Description copied from class: BufferedReadChannel
        Read as many bytes into dest as dest.capacity() starting at position pos in the FileChannel. This function can read from the buffer or the file channel depending on the implementation..
        Overrides:
        read in class BufferedReadChannel
        Returns:
        The total number of bytes read. -1 if the given position is greater than or equal to the file's current size.
        Throws:
        IOException - if I/O error occurs

        public void clear()
        Overrides:
        clear in class BufferedReadChannel
